byline.affiliation: Institut fuer Numerische und instrumentelle Mathematik

front.div:
Abstract – Acoustic pyrometry is a measurement technique for the temperature of
flue gas inside large scale combustion chambers. Detection of first arrival times of
acoustic signals leads to coarse reconstructions of the velocity of sound which is
directly related to gas temperature. In addition these data contain information about
the velocity of flue gas.
Waveform inversion makes use of the time resolved data recorded by the micro-
phones and detects a more detailed model for the speed of sound by solving the
inverse problem of the appropriate wave equation.
